result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher David Duff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond will be applied. Balance will be returned to the party that posted it

Report clean and sober
Huber granted
May serve in Dane County
Consecutive to: any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher David Duff

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Christopher David Duff in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2.  ct. 1 to be dismissed and read-in.  

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2:  Court orders 90 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before March 3, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*May serve in Dane County
*Pay $400 + costs = $757.00
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it.

Ct. 1 to be dismissed and read-in.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant called his office earlier this week and advised that the hearing he thought was set for tomorrow and not today.  Atty Gumz asks that the court allow the defendant to appear tomorrow.
Atty Hendee responds.

BY THE COURT:  Court will allow the reset to tomorrow at 10:45am.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2017 at 10:45 am.

Return date on October 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher David Duff in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.  
Set for Return
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Court questions defendant.  Defendant states he would like some time to hire counsel and would waive the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant on waiver of time limits and finds they have been waived.

Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Christopher David Duff by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee requests a $2,500 cash bond.  Defendant requests signature bond.  States he has never missed a court date.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets $1000.00 cash bond.  
Court advises defendant of the time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Defendant would like to have preliminary hearing set within the next 10 days.
BY THE COURT:  Set preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 09:45 am.
